title: Google\Cloud\Build\V1\WorkerPool
name: WorkerPool
description:
Configuration for a WorkerPool to run the builds.

Workers are machines that Cloud Build uses to run your builds. By default, all workers run in a project owned by Cloud Build. To have full control over the workers that execute your builds -- such as enabling them to access private resources on your private network -- you can request Cloud Build to run the workers in your own project by creating a custom workers pool.

Generated from protobuf message google.devtools.cloudbuild.v1.WorkerPool

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: User-defined name of the WorkerPool.

params.name: data.project_id
params.description: The project ID of the GCP project for which the WorkerPool is created.

params.name: data.service_account_email
params.description: Output only. The service account used to manage the WorkerPool. The service account must have the Compute Instance Admin (Beta) permission at the project level.

params.name: data.worker_count
params.description: Total number of workers to be created across all requested regions.

params.name: data.worker_config
params.description: Configuration to be used for a creating workers in the WorkerPool.

params.name: data.regions
params.description: List of regions to create the WorkerPool. Regions can't be empty. If Cloud Build adds a new GCP region in the future, the existing WorkerPool will not be enabled in the new region automatically; you must add the new region to the regions field to enable the WorkerPool in that region.

params.name: data.delete_time
params.description: Output only. Time at which the request to delete the WorkerPool was received.

params.name: data.status
params.description: Output only. WorkerPool Status.
